alert.note: Alert for Stewart; Webster (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 3:39AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Stewart and Webster Counties through 415 AM EDT... At 339 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Kimbrough, or near Lumpkin, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Lumpkin, Preston, Richland, Weston, Troutman, Kimbrough, Westville, Centerpoint, Dumas and Leveretts. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
